nistRequirement: Display a system use notification message with privacy and security notices consistent with applicable CUI rules before granting access to the system.
researchNotes: System use notifications can be implemented through Windows logon banners, Azure AD sign-in page customization, Conditional Access Terms of Use, and mobile device lock screen messages. Settings apply to different layers: endpoint (Windows/iOS/Android), cloud authentication (Azure AD), and application (Intune Company Portal).

settings.expectedValue: String containing legal notice text (max 4096 characters recommended)
settings.description: Specifies text message displayed to users when they log on to Windows. Used for legal warnings, security notices, or acceptable use policy notifications before granting system access.
settings.implementationGuide:
1. Sign in to Microsoft Intune admin center (https://endpoint.microsoft.com)
2. Navigate to Devices > Windows > Configuration profiles
3. Click Create profile > Platform: Windows 10 and later, Profile type: Settings catalog
4. Name: 'Windows Interactive Logon Message'
5. Click Add settings > Browse: Local Policies Security Options
6. Select 'Interactive Logon Message Text For Users Attempting To Log On'
7. Enter your legal notice text (recommend <2000 characters for compatibility)
8. Assign to device groups
9. Note: Will break Autopilot pre-provisioning if enabled

controlMappings.mappingRationale: Directly enforces NIST requirement by displaying security notice before Windows logon, ensuring users see CUI-related warnings before system access.
controlMappings.nistRequirement: Display system use notification message before granting access to the system

settings.expectedValue: String containing title for logon message dialog (e.g., 'SECURITY NOTICE', 'Important Legal Notice')
settings.description: Specifies title that appears in the window title bar containing the Interactive logon message text. Typically used to emphasize the legal or security nature of the notice.
settings.implementationGuide:
1. Sign in to Microsoft Intune admin center (https://endpoint.microsoft.com)
2. Navigate to Devices > Windows > Configuration profiles
3. Use same profile created for message text (or create new)
4. Click Add settings > Browse: Local Policies Security Options
5. Select 'Interactive Logon Message Title For Users Attempting To Log On'
6. Enter title text (e.g., 'SECURITY WARNING', 'Authorized Use Only')
7. Configure together with message text setting
8. User must click OK to acknowledge before login proceeds

controlMappings.mappingRationale: Complements message text by providing prominent title for security notice dialog, ensuring user attention before Windows system access.
controlMappings.nistRequirement: Display system use notification message before granting access to the system

settings.expectedValue: Text containing security notice, acceptable use policy, or legal disclaimer (max 256 characters)
settings.description: Text that appears at the bottom of the Azure AD sign-in page. Can be used to communicate security notices, legal statements, or help desk contact information before cloud authentication.
settings.implementationGuide:
1. Sign in to Microsoft Entra admin center (https://entra.microsoft.com)
2. Navigate to Microsoft Entra ID > Company branding
3. Click Edit (or Create if no branding exists)
4. Go to Sign-in form section
5. In 'Sign-in page text' field, enter your notice (max 256 characters)
6. Text appears below sign-in form on Azure AD login pages
7. Applies to all Microsoft 365 authentication flows
8. Requires Azure AD Premium P1 or P2 license

controlMappings.mappingRationale: Displays security notice on Azure AD sign-in page before cloud authentication to Microsoft 365, Azure, and other services processing CUI.
controlMappings.nistRequirement: Display privacy and security notices before granting access to the system

settings.displayName: Azure AD Sign-In Page - Privacy & Cookies Link
settings.expectedValue: URL to organization's privacy policy (optional custom display text)
settings.description: Custom privacy and cookies link displayed in footer of Azure AD sign-in page. Can replace Microsoft's default link with organization-specific privacy policy.
settings.implementationGuide:
1. Sign in to Microsoft Entra admin center (https://entra.microsoft.com)
2. Navigate to Microsoft Entra ID > Company branding
3. Click Edit > Layout section > Enable 'Show footer'
4. Under Footer section, configure 'Privacy & Cookies' settings:
   - Display text: Custom text for link
   - URL: Organization's privacy policy URL
5. Appears in footer of sign-in page
6. Note: Different from Conditional Access Terms of Use

controlMappings.mappingRationale: Provides access to organization privacy notices on sign-in page. Complements but does not enforce acknowledgment of policies.
controlMappings.nistRequirement: Display privacy notices consistent with applicable CUI rules

settings.displayName: Azure AD Sign-In Page - Terms of Use Link
settings.expectedValue: URL to organization's terms of use (optional custom display text)
settings.description: Custom terms of use link displayed in footer of Azure AD sign-in page. Note: This is NOT the same as Conditional Access Terms of Use (which requires acceptance).
settings.implementationGuide:
1. Sign in to Microsoft Entra admin center (https://entra.microsoft.com)
2. Navigate to Microsoft Entra ID > Company branding
3. Click Edit > Layout section > Enable 'Show footer'
4. Under Footer section, configure 'Terms of Use' settings:
   - Display text: Custom text for link
   - URL: Organization's terms of use URL
5. Link appears in footer but does not require acceptance
6. For enforced acceptance, use Conditional Access Terms of Use instead

controlMappings.mappingRationale: Provides passive link to terms of use but does not display notice or require acknowledgment. Consider using Conditional Access Terms of Use for enforcement.
controlMappings.nistRequirement: Display security notices consistent with applicable CUI rules

settings.displayName: Conditional Access - Terms of Use Policy
settings.expectedValue: PDF document containing legal notices, acceptable use policy, security warnings (file uploaded to Azure AD)
settings.description: PDF document with organization's terms of use, legal notices, and security policies. Users must accept before accessing applications protected by Conditional Access policy.
settings.implementationGuide:
1. Create PDF document with legal/security notices (recommended: 24pt font for mobile compatibility)
2. Sign in to Microsoft Entra admin center (https://entra.microsoft.com)
3. Navigate to Protection > Conditional Access > Terms of use
4. Click New terms
5. Configure:
   - Name: Internal name (e.g., 'CUI Security Notice')
   - Display name: User-visible name
   - Upload PDF document
   - Require users to expand: Enable (forces review)
   - Select language
6. Enforcement method: Select 'Custom policy' to create Conditional Access policy
7. Requires Azure AD Premium P1 license

controlMappings.mappingRationale: Enforces display and acknowledgment of security notices before granting access to cloud applications. Users must explicitly accept terms before continuing.
controlMappings.nistRequirement: Display system use notification message before granting access to the system

settings.displayName: Conditional Access - Terms of Use Display Name
settings.expectedValue: User-facing name for terms of use (e.g., 'Security and Acceptable Use Policy', 'CUI Handling Agreement')
settings.description: Display name shown to users when presented with terms of use dialog. Should clearly indicate nature of agreement (security, legal, acceptable use).
settings.implementationGuide:
1. In Conditional Access > Terms of use > New terms
2. Set 'Display name' field
3. This name appears to users in acceptance dialog
4. Supports multiple languages (add language-specific versions)
5. Keep concise but descriptive (e.g., 'System Security Notice', 'Authorized Use Policy')

controlMappings.mappingRationale: Provides clear identification of security notice type to users during acceptance process.
controlMappings.nistRequirement: Display security notices consistent with applicable CUI rules

settings.displayName: Conditional Access - Require Users to Expand Terms
settings.description: Forces users to expand and view full terms of use PDF before accepting. Prevents 'click-through' acceptance without reading.
settings.implementationGuide:
1. When creating Terms of Use policy
2. Enable 'Require users to expand the terms of use'
3. Users must click to expand PDF before Accept button becomes available
4. Ensures users actually view security notices before acceptance
5. Recommended setting: Enabled for all security/legal notices

controlMappings.mappingRationale: Ensures users actually view security notices before system access rather than blindly clicking accept.
controlMappings.nistRequirement: Display system use notification message before granting access

settings.displayName: Conditional Access - Require Consent on Every Device
settings.description: Requires users to accept terms of use on each device they use to access applications. Device must be registered with Azure AD.
settings.implementationGuide:
1. When creating Terms of Use policy
2. Enable 'Require users to consent on every device'
3. Users must accept on each device (work PC, mobile, home PC)
4. Note: Device must be registered/joined to Azure AD for tracking
5. Use for: High-security environments, BYOD scenarios
6. Consideration: May impact user experience with frequent prompts

controlMappings.mappingRationale: Ensures security notice presented on each device accessing system. Useful for BYOD or multi-device scenarios but not strictly required by NIST.
controlMappings.nistRequirement: Display system use notification before granting access

settings.expectedValue: Security notice or legal disclaimer text (e.g., 'Property of [Org]. Authorized Use Only. Violators Will Be Prosecuted.')
settings.description: Text displayed on iOS/iPadOS device lock screen. Can include security warnings, ownership information, or legal notices visible before device unlock.
settings.implementationGuide:
1. Sign in to Microsoft Intune admin center (https://endpoint.microsoft.com)
2. Navigate to Devices > iOS/iPadOS > Configuration profiles
3. Create profile > Platform: iOS/iPadOS, Profile type: Settings catalog
4. Name: 'iOS Lock Screen Message'
5. Add settings > Browse: System Configuration > Lock Screen Message
6. Select 'Lock Screen Footnote'
7. Enter message text (keep concise for readability)
8. Assign to iOS device groups
9. Note: Only works on Supervised devices (Apple Business Manager/School Manager enrolled)

controlMappings.mappingRationale: Displays security notice on iOS device lock screen before user authentication, providing pre-access notification of security policies.
controlMappings.nistRequirement: Display system use notification message before granting access to the system

settings.expectedValue: Organization name, ownership statement, or 'If found return to' message
settings.description: Asset tag information displayed on iOS/iPadOS lock screen and login window. Typically used for device ownership identification and return instructions.
settings.implementationGuide:
1. In same Settings Catalog profile as Lock Screen Footnote
2. Add settings > System Configuration > Lock Screen Message
3. Select 'Asset Tag Information'
4. Enter text (e.g., 'Property of ABC Corp', 'If lost, call 555-1234')
5. Appears with lock screen message
6. Use together with footnote for comprehensive notice
7. Only for Supervised iOS/iPadOS devices

controlMappings.mappingRationale: Supplements lock screen security notice with ownership/contact information. Supports but not directly enforces security notification requirement.
controlMappings.nistRequirement: Display system use notification message before granting access

settings.expectedValue: Security notice text for lock screen (max 4096 characters, supports device tokens)
settings.description: Custom message displayed on Android device lock screen. Can include security warnings, legal notices, and device-specific information using tokens ({{deviceName}}, {{serialNumber}}, etc.).
settings.implementationGuide:
1. Sign in to Microsoft Intune admin center (https://endpoint.microsoft.com)
2. Navigate to Devices > Android > Configuration profiles
3. Create profile > Platform: Android Enterprise, Profile: Device restrictions
4. Select enrollment type (Personally-owned work profile or Corporate-owned work profile)
5. Under Settings > System, configure 'Lock screen message':
   - All, except when specified: Default message for all languages
   - Select locale: Language-specific messages
6. Can use device tokens: {{deviceName}}, {{serialNumber}}, {{WiFiMacAddress}}, {{IMEI}}, {{phoneNumber}}
7. Message auto-translates to device's default language
8. Assign to Android device groups

controlMappings.mappingRationale: Displays security notice on Android device lock screen before authentication, providing pre-access system use notification.
controlMappings.nistRequirement: Display system use notification message before granting access to the system

settings.expectedValue: Brief message shown when user tries to change managed setting (max 4096 characters)
settings.description: Short message displayed when Android users attempt to modify settings managed by organization. Can include security policy reminders or IT contact information.
settings.implementationGuide:
1. In Android Device Restrictions profile
2. Under System settings, configure 'Short support message'
3. Enter brief message (e.g., 'This setting is managed by IT. Contact helpdesk@org.com for changes.')
4. Appears when user tries to change managed settings
5. Click 'Learn more' shows long support message
6. Available for: Corporate-owned Android Enterprise devices
7. Message not translated automatically - create locale-specific versions if needed

controlMappings.mappingRationale: Provides security policy context when users encounter restrictions, but shown reactively rather than proactively before access.
controlMappings.nistRequirement: Display security notices consistent with applicable CUI rules

settings.expectedValue: Custom privacy message explaining what organization can/cannot see on managed devices
settings.description: Privacy message displayed in Company Portal app on iOS/iPadOS devices. Informs users what organization can see/control vs. what remains private on their devices.
settings.implementationGuide:
1. Sign in to Microsoft Intune admin center (https://endpoint.microsoft.com)
2. Navigate to Tenant administration > Customization
3. Edit default policy or create custom policy
4. Under Configuration > Privacy section:
   - Configure 'Privacy message in Company Portal for iOS/iPadOS'
5. Click 'Customize message' to use rich text editor
6. Include: What IT can see (apps, compliance status), What IT cannot see (personal data, browsing history)
7. Message appears in Company Portal app > Settings > Privacy
8. Supports up to 25 custom branding policies for different user groups

controlMappings.mappingRationale: Provides privacy notice accessible in Company Portal app. Complements but does not enforce pre-access notification requirement.
controlMappings.nistRequirement: Display privacy notices consistent with applicable CUI rules

controlMappings.mappingRationale: Directly addresses privacy statement requirement by informing users what organization can/cannot access.
controlMappings.nistRequirement: Provide a publicly accessible privacy statement

criticalRequirements: At minimum, configure Windows Interactive Logon message for on-premises devices and Azure AD sign-in page text for cloud authentication
Conditional Access Terms of Use provides strongest enforcement with required acceptance before app access
Mobile devices (iOS/Android) should have lock screen messages configured for supervised/managed devices
Windows logon banner will break Autopilot white glove/pre-provisioning - exempt pilot devices if using this feature
licensingRequirements: Azure AD Premium P1: Required for Conditional Access Terms of Use, custom company branding
Azure AD Premium P2: Not required but includes P1 features
Microsoft Intune: Required for all endpoint device configurations
iOS/iPadOS Supervised Devices: Requires Apple Business Manager or Apple School Manager enrollment for lock screen messages
implementationNotes.multiLayerApproach: System use notifications should be implemented at multiple layers: (1) Endpoint level (Windows logon, mobile lock screen), (2) Cloud authentication level (Azure AD sign-in page, Conditional Access), (3) Application level (Company Portal privacy statements). Each layer serves different access scenarios.
complianceConsiderations: Legal review required for all message content - consult legal and HR before deployment
Messages should reference CUI handling requirements, authorized use only, monitoring/audit notices
Consider secondary notifications for specific high-risk applications beyond general system access
Maintain audit logs of Terms of Use acceptance for compliance evidence
commonPitfalls: Setting Windows logon message too long - recommend <2000 characters to avoid truncation issues
Not testing Terms of Use with mobile devices - ensure PDF is mobile-friendly (24pt font minimum)
Forgetting to exempt emergency access accounts from Conditional Access Terms of Use policies
Not creating language-specific versions for global organizations
Deploying logon banners to Autopilot pre-provision devices and breaking deployment
